instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3435 SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Have 820-3435 logic board with water damage in U7090 area. First there was no green light and ppbus. Fixed it replacing U7090 and R7006. 

Now when plug magsafe it going orange -> green - > orange -> just like something is reseting smc constantly. Checked SMC _RESET_L and it has 3.4 V droping to 3V when charger light goes green. 

There was corrosion near J6100 and i removed it completely. 

Any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-3435 SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Remove R7100 and check if SMC_RESET_L still fluctuates.
Use o-scope, if possible; it can show if voltage drop to 0V.

Post all voltages of U5110.
Take time and check which ones fluctuates.

threads.title: 820-3435 SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
Removed R7100 and SMC_RESET_L is stable. Magsafe orange.
U5110
1 3.4V
2 0V
3 3.4V
4 2.8V
53,4V (about 0,1V fluctuation)
63,4V (about 0,02V fluctuation)
7 3,4V (about 0,02V fluctuation)
8 3,3 V
Right now dont have o-scope. Can try to check it tomorrow.

threads.title: 820-3435 SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message:
"Removed R7100 and SMC_RESET_L is stable."
Then change U7100.

threads.title: 820-3435 SMC resettin constantly.
threads.message: Already changed but will try again. Muchas gracias informaticos :)
